Name: Shabti of Sethos I
Description: The Museum of Brussels posseses four shabtis of the pharaoh Sethos I. Only one (E.8386) is made of blue faience, the other three (E.5551, E.5563A - B) in wood. This example in wood show the mummiform king wearing a long wig. The arms are crossed on the chest and the hands hold two hoes. The hieroglyphic text, badly deteriorated, is borrowed from Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead. The figurine was orignally painted in black.
